As shown in Figure 2b, a typical LOB system consists of a negative electrode (Li metal), a positive electrode (primarily a carbonaceous material), and an electrolyte (generally divided into aqueous, non-aqueous, hybrid, and solid electrolytes) [ 6]. During the electrochemical reaction in LOBs, Li 2O 2 is formed as a by-product of the interaction between O 2 and Li + during the discharge process before decomposing again during subsequent charging.
